page.title: 01LANDSCAPE,TOPOGRAPHY
page.content: The area lies within the valley of the R.USK which here is flowing east- wards towards Brecon.The valley floor is quite narrow, seldom exceeding 500 metres. The sides of the valley generally rise gently with no steep slopes excepting along the river banks in some places.The floor of the valley lies at about 180 metres above sea- level. North of the river the land rises to about 300 metres. Two import- ant tributaries of the R.Usk flow into it within this area; the Afon Senni which flows northwards from the higher montains of the Brecon Beacons and the Afon Cilenni which drains the upland of MYNYDD EPPYNT and flows into the Usk from the north-west. Part of the area lies within the BRECON BEACONS NATIONAL PARK.The northern boundary of the Park follows a minor road north of the river.
